intro: Bentinckiopsis, commonly known as the slender sandmat, is a flowering plant species native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit with fleshy, succulent leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish or reddish in color. Bentinckiopsis is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, often storing water in its thick leaves. It plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing habitat for small desert organisms.
